lines:
# KAL 
TSING HUA COLLEGE

PEKING

Peking,

armangement for these boys. He is supposed to submit his 
arrangement to Mr. Tsur by writing to him in care of the 
Pacific Mail Steamship Company of Frisce. Now five of these 
boys have decided to go to Andover. You will please write 
to Mr. T. T. Wong (2006 columbia Road, Washington D. C.) to 
apply for the same so as to make sure that they will get to 
Andover. If Mr. Wong gives us a favorable reply, then I a 
shall be only too glad to bring these boys direct to Andover 
from Frisco without first going to Washington in order to 
save time and money, as I am expecting to visit Andover 
before going to New Haven any way. Herewith I am expeet 
enclose you a list of their names. Please let me know the 
result of this arrangement by writing to me in care of the 
Pacific Mail Steamship Company.

As I mentioned before, the President hinself 
will accompany us to the States. The party is composed 
of 88 boys and 10 girl-students together with about three 
teachers. We expect to be in San Franfcisco about the 10th 
of September. Hoping to see you and my old friends soon,

Mrs. Tong Kaison is now in Tientsin staying with 
her brother. She is quite well now. Her address is as 
follows: a c/o Mr. G. W. Kwan, Shipping Office, Peking -
Mukden Railway, Tientsin.

Wishing you a pleasant summer vacation. With 
best regards and greetings to you and Mrs. Stearns,

Yours respectfully and sincerely,

Etwan
raw: # KAL TSING HUA COLLEGE PEKING Peking, armangement for these boys. He is supposed to submit his arrangement to Mr. Tsur by writing to him in care of the Pacific Mail Steamship Company of Frisce. Now five of these boys have decided to go to Andover. You will please write to Mr. T. T. Wong (2006 columbia Road, Washington D. C.) to apply for the same so as to make sure that they will get to Andover. If Mr. Wong gives us a favorable reply, then I a shall be only too glad to bring these boys direct to Andover from Frisco without first going to Washington in order to save time and money, as I am expecting to visit Andover before going to New Haven any way. Herewith I am expeet enclose you a list of their names. Please let me know the result of this arrangement by writing to me in care of the Pacific Mail Steamship Company. As I mentioned before, the President hinself will accompany us to the States. The party is composed of 88 boys and 10 girl-students together with about three teachers. We expect to be in San Franfcisco about the 10th of September. Hoping to see you and my old friends soon, Mrs. Tong Kaison is now in Tientsin staying with her brother. She is quite well now. Her address is as follows: a c/o Mr. G. W. Kwan, Shipping Office, PekingMukden Railway, Tientsin. Wishing you a pleasant summer vacation. With best regards and greetings to you and Mrs. Stearns, Yours respectfully and sincerely, Etwan

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter thanking Stearns for the course catalogues and reporting that of the 11 students attending Andover, 5 students (list enclosed) had been chosen by Mr. Tong Kaison in 1911, but the delay was due to strained financial conditions. The average age of the students is 16 or 17 and they are eager to study in America. [List: Hsueh Hsueh Hai, Huan Chi Yen, Lu Shou Chen, Li Kuo Chow, Van Han Tsen] He notes that President of Tsing Hua College, Y. Tsur, asked the Director of the Indemnity Fund Students, Mr. T.T. Wong, to make arrangements for the boys. He asks Stearns to write to Mr. Wong to apply for same and offers to follow through with the students plans to attend Andover. A party of 98 students is to visit San Francisco in September. He includes the Tientsin address of Mrs. Tong Kaison.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
